Account Manager

Company Name Ipsos Australia Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 90 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Ipsos and the role

Ipsos Australia is a leading global market research company with offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Perth and Brisbane. We provide quantitative and qualitative research across Australia to national and international clients, and globally rank as the 3rd largest market research company.


Our specialised team within Ipsos implements and manages customer experience programs and solutions that enable organisations to capture customer feedback, understand it and make it available, often in real time. As part of our team you will play a valuable role in improving the experience customers have in dealing with leading organisations. We are looking for a market research specialist to work closely with clients to understand their requirements and undertake end to end management of research programs including insights and client presentations.


Culture & Benefits

Being part of a global company, you will experience a vibrant environment surrounded by experts, innovation, teamwork, thought leadership and global thinking. Our focus is on providing our clients with high quality research solutions and curiosity is one of our core values. Our people are important to us, and locally we offer a number of attractive benefits including professional development, regular social events, paid volunteer days, birthday leave and well-appointed office amenities with fruit, breakfast and coffee provided.

\xa0

To be successful in this role you will:

  • Have approximately 5+ market research experience, ideally in a research agency, with hands on quantitative project management, questionnaire design, data analysis/insight generation, quality research presentation preparation and presentation to clients
  • Be obsessed with the accuracy and detail that are crucial to delivery, whist doing this in the context of understanding the bigger picture and have the ability to see things through both the client and customer lens
  • Be effective at multi-tasking and able to manage time, cost and quality to achieve great client satisfaction
  • Have excellent written and oral communication skills and will keep everyone informed and up-to-date
  • Be a motivated self-starter that can also work well in a cohesive team
  • Have good hands-on knowledge of SPSS, Q or similar.
  • Have voice of the customer research experience using real time technology platforms would be viewed favourably
  • Be tertiary qualified in psychology, marketing, economics, business or similar
  • Have qualitative research experience would be viewed favourable


This position is only open to applicants who have the right to live and work in Australia.

\xa0

If you have the necessary skills and experience, please apply with your LinkedIn profile and attaching your CV.


For further information and to keep up to date with Ipsos job opportunities, follow Ipsos on LinkedIn.

Company Name PwC Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description

Senior Consultant – SAP Auditor
  • Flexible work options - work smarter in a way that suits your lifestyle
  • Opportunity to work with top ASX clients
  • Agile, diverse & inclusive team

Join PwC’s Risk Assurance team as a Senior Consultant within our technology risk team and foster relationships with clients and help them to strengthen their SAP risk profile.

The Opportunity

At PwC, we help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From improving healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting Australia’s start up industry, you’ll build trust in society and solve important problems.

The Risk Assurance team brings this to life by developing technology and risk management strategies and methodologies for a wide range of clients. As a Senior Consultant your impact will be seen by managing a portfolio of clients and providing expert technology risk advice specifically with our clients in the SAP space.

Success does stem from a positive attitude, hard work and going the extra mile, but that’s not all!

You will

  • Build on your existing technology risk skills by working with a team of professionals
  • Strengthen internal controls and risk management processes
  • Have a commercial mindset and drive to solve important problems

    • About You

    The brief is simple...

    You have a solid background in technology risk and are capable of partnering with IT and Audit professionals to deliver the best outcomes to our clients. You’re passionate about identifying priority areas of risk and process improvement by understanding the organisation's systems, objectives, risks, control framework and regulatory environment to prevent future loss. You thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture and want to join a firm that values problem solvers, the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and key stakeholders.

    Your colleagues can vouch that you

  • Act with integrity and show care for the people you work with
  • Demonstrate an ability to foster relationships internally and externally
  • Have 3-5 years of controls experience gained working in IT Audit
  • Understanding of SAP systems and implementation
  • Sound experience in assessing and/or designing SAP technologies, including HANA, ECC and GRC from a security and business process configuration perspective
  • Background and knowledge of Assurance
  • Assist in the development of risk management strategies and methodologies
  • Technical skills in controls, risk and technology reviews

    • Sound like you? Read on.

    What we offer

    Working for Australia’s largest professional services firm you’ll join a global network spanning 157 countries that delivers meaningful outcomes for a wide range of clients.

    Our culture and benefits are why we’re LinkedIn’s number one Australian workplace. With state of the art offices and premium technology, each person has access to flexible work options. The dress policy is flexible too – you choose what you wear based on the work you do with your team and clients.

    Fostering an inclusive culture and embracing differences is at the core of everything we do. PwC empowers you to be yourself and work with people from many backgrounds to achieve things never thought possible. Get involved in our employee-led diversity networks (cultural, disability, LGBTI or gender equality) and benefit from our best-in-class policies such as 18 weeks maternity/paternity leave, flexible work and gender equity.

    Up for a challenge? We’re committed to helping our people unleash their potential. Hard work doesn’t go unrewarded and industry best coaching, mentoring, training and development are ready and waiting. If you hold a genuine desire to make a difference and want to surround yourself with like-minded, talented and driven individuals who strive to do the same, apply now.

    Andy Hinton is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

Post Graduate Cardiac Program

Company Name Northern Health Company Location Epping, AU

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 6 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Reference Number 18647

Position Title Cardiology Nursing Post graduate programme

Employment Type Temporary Part Time

Directorate Directorate Acute Health

Division Emergency Services

Location Northern Health (all campuses)

Award Classification 22 - Registered Nurses - YP6 - RN GRADE 2 YEAR 5

Position Summary

Applications are now open for the Cardiac Nursing Graduate Certificate program

Graduate Certificate in Cardiac Nursing will be conducted over 12 months commencing early 2018

Our Cardiology Unit and Cath Lab are among the busiest in Victoria receiving 5,000 patients each year, including 2,000 patients presenting with acute myocardial infarction. The Cardiology Unit operates a STEMI service 24/7 and admits both elective and emergency conditions.

We provide a range of cardiac diagnostic investigations and interventional procedures for patients with heart disease: pacemaker implantation, coronary angiography/stenting, electrophysiology studies, radio frequency ablation, fractional flow reserve studies, loop recorder insertion, ICD implantation, cardiac MRI, stress testing, and telemetry monitoring.

The Cardiology Unit comprises 8 acute and 22 telemetry beds that are supported by a team of highly skilled cardiologists and trained cardiac nurses. The unit provides treatment to patients with acute coronary syndrome, heart failure, cardiac arrhythmias and cardiogenic shock. Our team collaborates with a variety of specialised health professionals to deliver high quality and comprehensive cardiac care; they include: pharmacists, physiotherapists, clinical nurse consultants (heart failure, cardiac rehabilitation) and; heart failure nurse practitioner.

Research and education is a key focus in the Cardiology Unit through ongoing participation in multi-centre international trials, investigator-initiated research, pharmaceutical and device based studies. Clinical support, regular in services and educational workshops are provided by dedicated staff: cardiac trained nurses, clinical support nurse and cardiology nurse educator.

All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory police records check and Working with Children check.

With our cardiology services continually expanding now is the time to invest in your career opportunities

Selection Criteria

Essential: A minimum of 24 months experience in Cardiology Nursing

You must have the right to live and work in Australia

Full-time

  • Analyst

Company Name Development Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 101 views

Job description

Job Type: Contract

Location: Melbourne, Australia

About Us

 Job Description

Development Victoria aims to create a sense of place and prosperity through development, urban renewal and community connection. Development Victoria formally operate as a statutory authority, reporting to a Board.

Development Victoria will deliver property and precinct development projects to meet government’s policy objectives and apply its experience and expertise to the delivery of civic projects that enhance our state. Development Victoria staff are skilled in realising opportunities and managing risks to develop publicly owned land and deliver complex projects.

Some of Development Victoria’s current projects include the revitalisation of central Dandenong, the Ballarat West Employment Zone, and the ongoing development of Docklands. It also oversees important civic projects such as the State Library, Flinders Street Station and Melbourne Park redevelopments. Projects in the pipeline include renewal of the Arden and Fishermans Bend precincts.

About The Role

An exciting opportunity is now available for a Receptionist/Office Assistant to join our team on a fixed-term 12-month contract. We are looking for a Receptionist to provide professional, friendly and efficient corporate reception to our clients.

As the first point of contact for all our clients, your key responsibilities will include:
  • Answering and appropriately managing all phone calls and face-to-face enquiries received at Development Victoria’s corporate front desk;
  • Develop and maintain knowledge of our projects to accurately assist our clients;
  • Ensure reception area and meeting rooms are maintained to a professional standard;
  • Oversee the booking of meeting rooms and a fleet of pool cars and
  • Provide a suite of administrative duties to support the business including but not limited to: daily mail processing, creation of reports, providing event support, ordering and distributing stationery and business cards, processing invoices and undertaking regular supplier reviews.


About You

 Desired Skills and Experience

The successful candidate will be professional, friendly, have strong attention detail, excellent verbal and written communication skills with proven experience in a similar role responsible for providing exceptional customer service within a corporate environment.

We’re looking for a team player ideally with experience using Skype for Business, finance/invoicing systems and intermediate Microsoft Office Skills.

Our Culture

Our culture is one of collaboration and positive contribution, suited to energetic and engaging team players who can readily adapt to changing priorities and bring a service-oriented approach.

We actively encourage sharing of knowledge and best practice across our teams. We respect and value every individual’s talents and contribution and harness these strengths to collectively achieve the kind of results we can all be proud of.

Development Victoria is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to making employment-related decisions without bias or discrimination.

The preferred candidate will be required to complete a national police records check prior to an offer of employment being made.

Does this sound like you?

If this sounds like an interesting opportunity for you, we welcome registrations of interest through the submission of a cover letter and resume. For a confidential discussion, please contact Ashley Brundell on 03 8317 3433 for further information. Applications close Monday 3 September 2018.

Community Reintegration Centre Manager

Company Name The GEO Group Australia Company Location Richmond, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 38 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you committed to implementing a holistic, evidence-based \xa0 continuum of care model?


This is a fantastic opportunity to manage Victoria’s only Community\xa0


Reintegration Centre providing post-release support for ex-prisoners

\xa0

\xa0

About the Opportunity

GEO is committed to improving reintegration outcomes for ex-prisoners through application of a continuum of care model. Integral to this model is the Community Reintegration Centre. This Centre, the only of its kind in Victoria, will provide a hub of post-release services and supports for men who have exited Ravenhall Correctional Centre as well as their broader families and support networks.


The Manager of the Community Reintegration Centre (CRC) will lead and manage the operations of this Centre working collaboratively with other GEO staff and community agencies (including Alliance Partners) to ensure holistic delivery of services to meet the treatment and reintegration needs of men who have transitioned from Ravenhall Correctional Centre to the Community. \xa0


This is a pivotal role in achieving GEO’s aim of improving reintegration outcomes for prisoners. In this role you will: \xa0


  • Contribute to the strategic direction and evolution of the CRC including development of the Operational Model and identification and coordination of service delivery at the Centre.
  • Provide clinical leadership, expert advice and consultation on issues related to transition, reintegration and Continuum of Care.
  • Providing line management, supervision, coaching and mentoring to CRC case management staff.
  • Provide operational management of the CRC, including but not limited to, its programs and services, sub-contracts, service level agreements, memoranda of understanding, letters of intent, partnerships and other informal relationships.
  • Liaise and work collaboratively with a range of internal and external stakeholders (including the State, community organisations and families) to ensure that programs and services delivered are effective in supporting reintegration and reducing reoffending risk.
  • Demonstrate a commitment to ongoing quality assurance practices as well as manage recording and reporting functions related to KPIs.
  • Undertake research related to the efficacy of services provided at the CRC and present outcomes at conferences and other appropriate events.
  • Participate in peer supervision with colleagues.


Your Skills & Experience

\xa0To be successful in the role of Community Reintegration Centre Manager you will have: \xa0


  • Relevant qualification in Social Work or other related field.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of research and evidence related to positive resettlement and reintegration outcomes for people released from prison.
  • Demonstrated training and experience in contract management with direct experience in managing governance, compliance and risk.
  • Previous experience in a role that required high level strategic planning, stakeholder management, financial and human resource responsibilities.
  • High level communication and interpersonal skills.
  • The ability to lead and manage a team to achieve shared goals and KPIs.


About the Benefits

Joining GEO is your chance to make a real and lasting difference in the lives of prisoners, their families and the community. Benefits of working for GEO, include but are not limited to:


  • Role diversity and internal career progression opportunities
  • Ongoing professional development opportunities (including further education sponsorship)
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Competitive salary and rewards scheme
  • Salary scarifice options
  • Free parking
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Staff gym
  • Subsidised meals

\xa0

\xa0

Make a real difference – Apply Now!


Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are highly encouraged to apply


Applications Close Friday, 14th September 2018

Training & Development Specialist

Company Name Renault Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Job description

Renault Australia are now seeking to engage a Training & Development Specialist to join the Renault Sales & Network team.\xa0 This position will have key responsibility for partnering with stakeholders across the business, to increase the effectiveness of Renault Dealership staff through the ongoing development and implementation of structured learning and development programs for the Renault brand.

\xa0

This position will report directly to the General Manager of Network Development, with key responsibilities for the following:

  • Partner with internal and external resources to develop and continuously improve the provision of training and development for the Network.

  • Develop and deliver training programs through suitable channels, to include classroom, online, in Dealership and 1:1 mentoring.

  • Manage and coordinate the services of external training providers for the delivery and facilitation of Renault training programs.

  • Manage the delivery and facilitation of training programs as appropriate such as product training, product launches, skills training etc.

  • Maintain develop and administer Renault online Learning Academy to:

    • Develop and deploy a structured learning pathway for Dealership staff

    • Promote upcoming training courses and product launches

    • Facilitate e-learning through an online education platform

    • Measure training attendance and learning outcomes

  • Manage and execute Network training and development projects as identified.

  • Manage the training & development calendar for the Network, championing participation across the Network.

  • Managing attendance, assessment, training needs and training records for all users.

    \xa0

To be considered for this opportunity, you will need:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing or Human Resources required.

  • Certification IV in Training & Assessment preferred.

  • Experience in training and development, and/or human resources, within an automotive environment essential.

  • Exemplary interpersonal and communication skills, and the ability to deliver clear and concise messages to the business and external stakeholders.

  • Ability to influence key stakeholders and build positive relationships.

  • Excellent organisational skills & capability to multi-task.

Permanent Part Time & Casual position vacancies | Continuous learning & development opportunities | Leading Aged Care provider

With over 20 years in the industry, we are an innovative Aged Care provider who focuses on continuing to achieve the best outcomes possible for our residents and our staff.

Our AIN/PCA staff are the people who we trust to provide the very best care to all our residents every day.

Regis, along with our residents and their families appreciate the dedication and hard work required to be an AIN/PCA and we have tried and true assessment process to give you the best opportunity for success in a role with Regis.

To join Regis in an AIN/PCA position, you must be available to attend all steps of the recruitment process. This process provides you with an additional level of training and skill development that gives you the self confidence in your skills and knowledge.

Skills & Evaluation Centre – Tuesday 18th & Wednesday 19th September (9:00am - 3:00pm)

Sensory & Consumer Science Manager - Southbank

Company Name Carlton & United Breweries Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About CUB

Carlton & United Breweries (CUB) is one of Australia’s most iconic companies. We locally brew some of Australia's most famous beers including Victoria Bitter, Carlton Draught, Pure Blonde, Great Northern, Matilda Bay and ciders including Strongbow, Mercury and Bulmers, as well as distribute some of the world’s leading international brands including Corona, Stella Artois and Budweiser.

Joining CUB, you are opening up a world of career possibilities. We are a part of AB InBev, the largest and only truly global brewer selling over 400 brands across 100 markets and employing 200,000 people. Our Dream is to bring people together for a better world. We are committed to driving growth that leads to better living for more people in more places and focused on bringing people and cultures together through our brands and experiences.

The Role

This role is responsible for leading the strategic thinking in Sensory & Consumer Science, take charge of Strategic Product Monitoring (SPM) and Competitiveness Product Testing (CPT) while managing zone Operational responsibilities in the Sensory & Consumer Science field.

Responsibilities will be (but not limited to)
  • Provide sensory insights into the APAC South product portfolio – using tools such as Product Landscape, taste profiles, analytical results and competitor information to guide product development
  • Lead the sensory strategy for APAC South, overseeing the Technical Development Taste function
  • Conduct internal tasting with the Zone Innovation & Technology (ZITEC), Insights & Innovation teams
  • Conduct quantitative testing with consumers and lead decisions relating to product performance
  • New Product Development (NPD) – collaborate with Global and other Zones to source information


Who You Are

You are someone who has an innovative and strategic mindset. You are a leader who excels working with ambiguity in a fast paced environment.
  • Tertiary qualified in Food Science & Technology is preferred, experienced in applied statistical methods is advantageous
  • At least 4+ years’ relevant experience within the alcoholic beverage and/or food industries
  • Experience and knowledge of Sensory and Consumer research methodologies
  • Exposure and thorough understanding of the NPD process
  • Innovation and problem solving skills – applying new solutions to old problems
  • Use leadership experience to influence and challenge current processes
  • Ability to prioritise and manage time effectively with multiple projects
  • A passion for beer is beneficial


What We Offer

Learn on the job. Jump in at the deep-end. Dream big!

At CUB, our greatest strength is our people. We recruit people who can be better than ourselves and retain people by allowing them to grow at their own pace, providing training opportunities and offering a safe environment where they will be rewarded for their contributions. To learn more, visit CUB - Our 10 principles.

Join one of the world’s largest consumer packaged goods companies where opportunity awaits. Apply now!

Job description

Here at Optus Retail, we’re excited about the potential for new ideas and new approaches to improve people’s lives and we’re looking for a Retail Consultant who feels the same.

The role

We’re currently looking for a Retail Consultant who is looking for a career or lifestyle change, to achieve a positive work/life balance.

As a Retail Consultant at Optus you can bring your wealth of experience to our stores. You’ll love to chat and have a genuine interest in people and their story. You’ll be responsible for setting Optus apart through your friendliness and positivity. It’s also imperative that you love contributing to a high performing team culture and enjoy keeping up to date with new products and services.

The perks

We offer personal development and formal on-the-job training, as well as an attractive salary package. You don’t need to understand phones and networks; we’ll give you all the training and development needed to be effective. As we move beyond the role of a traditional telco, we have new challenges and opportunities for those looking to join in, take them on and grow with us.

About You

We’re looking for reliable people who have valuable work and life experience and are ready to put those skills to use in a busy retail environment. Successful people in our stores come from diverse backgrounds, we’re looking for;
  • Communication - A great personality to provide incredible customer experiences
  • People Focus - You’re a listener and relationship builder, who can problem solve in a fast-paced environment
  • This is a sales role, so bring your solid experience of working with KPIs and targets
  • You’ll also have an interest in telecommunications


About Us

At Optus, we don’t sit back and let the future happen to us – we’re out there making it. By expanding into new technology and relentlessly improving every day, we’re creating a better tomorrow for all Australians. Apply now to join us.

Optus believes in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers.
